The National, Scotland's new daily newspaper, was launched on 24 November 2014 in response to the strong vote for Scottish independence in the referendum two months earlier. 

We are the only daily newspaper in Scotland to support independence for the country and in the aftermath of the referendum its main role is to hold the Westminster parties to the promises they made of significant new powers for the Scottish parliament. The National also campaigns against poverty and for greater social justice in Scotland, with a strong international focus and regular sporting and cultural profiles. 

Public response has been outstanding.  Our launch day print run of 60,000 virtually sold out and we are now outselling many long-established daily newspapers and have thousands of daily digital subscriptions.

We want to thank everyone who has purchased and supported The National in our first few weeks - and the 4,000+ people who took the time to complete a pretty detailed survey to help inform us as to who is buying the paper and what you/they want from their new daily read.  The initial results have been fascinating and we are now using all of this information to help refine and further develop The National, in print and online, to keep on building on our initial success and make 2015 even more successful.

Apart from Christmas Day, Boxing day, New Year's day and 2nd January, we'll be publishing every Monday to Friday in print and online into 2015 (and beyond).
